page.title: 05M.M.B. Creamery.Ellesmere
page.content: Ellesmere Dairy is right next to the basin of the Shropshire Union Canal. The Dairy opened in 1917 to collect milk and send it to London.The creamery opened soon after and started to make Cheshire cheese.Dairy Crest bought the creamery in 1979.Ellesmere creamery gets up to 650,000 litres of milk a day.That is roughly 15 tanker loads,which comes from 530 dairy farms in North Shropshire,Clwyd and Cheshire. Over 400 different staff work at the dairy.The differet staff are carpenters,fitters,builders,painters, electricions,engineering staff,office staff and cheese makers. The amount of milk that comes in depends on the time of year.When the grass is green and fresh the cows produce more milk.
